answers.author: Caitlyn Mitchell
answers.text:
In Illinois, municipalities have the authority to regulate the use of distilleries.
This directly reeferences distilleries used for agricultural and dairy use in the city of Chicago:
http://books.google.com/books?id=KJfPAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA397&lpg=PA397&dq=municipal+codes+for+distilleries+uses&source=bl&ots=BvmmGMedTM&sig=W-usFnavPYqBn63staKuG1pGhXI&hl=en&ei=PvyQTd3jI46ssAOy0cirDg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CCoQ6AEwAw#v=onepage&q&f=false
This is the Illionois state code giving municipalities the authority to regulate the use of distilleries:
http://law.onecle.com/illinois/65ilcs5/11-42-8.html
And here is the municipal code for Palm Springs which allows for distilleries in agricultural use for certain chemicals or non-alcoholic beverages:
http://qcode.us/codes/palmsprings/view.php?topic=zoning_code-92_00-92_17_1_01&frames=on

text: Does your municipality/jurisdiction allow distilleries as a specific use in your code?  More specifically is it allowed as an agricultural use within your code?
title: Distillery use
